title: Opening files in WASM32-WASI does not work
body: Hello, I may just miss-understand how this is supposed to be used, but I cannot find a way to get a simple rust program to open a file in wasm32-wasi (tried a few VMs and at this point I am almost certain the issue sits with the implementation here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/libstd/sys/wasi/fs.rs In the host VM (e.g. for WAMR): ```cpp const char* dirs[] = {".", "./"}; // This method isn't super documented (what is env?), but I hope this is the correct way to set the dirs. wasm_runtime_set_wasi_args(module_handle, dirs, 2, nullptr, 0, nullptr, 0, nullptr, 0); instance = wasm_runtime_instantiate(module_handle, stack_size, heap_size, ...); // Then i run the main() function with no args. ``` The rust program: ```rs #[no_mangle] extern "C" fn main() { println!("Hello world!"); let f = File::open("myfile.txt").unwrap(); } ``` The error I get: ``` thread '' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Custom { kind: Other, error: "failed to find a preopened file descriptor through which \"myfile.txt\" could be opened" }', src/lib.rs:9:13 ``` This is generated by [this file](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/src/libstd/sys/wasi/fs.rs#L629) from rust's libstd. ```rs let fd = __wasilibc_find_relpath(p.as_ptr(), &mut ret); if fd == -1 { let msg = format!( "failed to find a preopened file descriptor \ through which {:?} could be opened", p ); return Err(io::Error::new(io::ErrorKind::Other, msg)); } ``` I did check that: 1) any other rust programs work just fine (e.g. "Hello world!" is printed). 2) the file is there. 3) I build the VM with wasi support: `set (WAMR_BUILD_LIBC_WASI 1)` Could the team clarify a few things: Where is `__wasilibc_find_relpath` function supposed to come from? A quick github search doesn't show anything about it. It also does not seem to be a standard WASI method. WAMR devs suggested in this issue (https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-micro-runtime/issues/278) that `path_open` is the correct method that needs to be called, but I can't seem to make rust stdlib use it even this basic program. Is this a bug in rust stdlib's implementation for WASI, am I missing some methods? ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.44.0 (49cae5576 2020-06-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 49cae55760da0a43428eba73abcb659bb70cf2e4 commit-date: 2020-06-01 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.44.0 LLVM version: 9.0 ``` ``` thread '' panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Custom { kind: Other, error: "failed to find a preopened file descriptor through which \"myfile.txt\" could be opened" }', src/lib.rs:9:13 ```
